intro: Pyrethrum myconis var. albidum, commonly known as the white pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its pale to white flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. This variety is valued for ornamental purposes and has mild insect-repelling properties due to its pyrethrin content.
